clinical_study.brief_title: EMD for Treatment of Proximal Class-II Furcation Involvements
clinical_study.official_title: Enamel Matriz Derivate for Treatment of Proximal Class II Furcation Defects: a Randomized Clinical Trial

clinical_study.source: Universidade Estadual Paulista Júlio de Mesquita Filho

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the present study is to evaluate the clinical response of proximal furcations treated with enamel matrix derivative proteins (EMD).

detailed_description.textblock: Proximal class-II furcation represents a challeng to periodontal therapy. Studies show that the ultrasonic non-surgical therapy doesn't work in these defects and the guided tissue regeneration therapy with membranes also demonstrates an unpredictable improvement. Therefore, enamel matrix derivative proteins (EMD) have been proposed as a periodontal regenerative procedure due to their fundamental role in cementum development.

intervention.description: Open flap debridement to enamel matrix derivative to treat proximal furcation involvements.
